reading_writing.title: SAT Reading & Writing
reading_writing.description: Comprehensive framework for SAT Reading and Writing content domains and skills

information_and_ideas.title: Information and Ideas
information_and_ideas.description: Measures comprehension, analysis, and reasoning skills to locate, interpret, evaluate, and integrate information and ideas from texts and informational graphics

command_of_evidence.title: Command of Evidence
command_of_evidence.description: Ability to locate, interpret, and evaluate textual evidence to support analysis and inference

inferences.title: Inferences
inferences.description: Drawing logical conclusions from explicit and implicit information in texts
learning_objectives: Distinguish between stated and implied information

central_ideas_and_details.title: Central Ideas and Details
central_ideas_and_details.description: Identifying main ideas, themes, and supporting details in texts
learning_objectives: Distinguish main ideas from supporting details

craft_and_structure.title: Craft and Structure
craft_and_structure.description: Measures comprehension, vocabulary, analysis, and reasoning to understand high-utility words, evaluate texts rhetorically, and make connections

words_in_context.title: Words in Context
words_in_context.description: Understanding meaning of words and phrases based on context clues and usage
learning_objectives: Analyze how word choice affects meaning
Identify shifts in connotation and tone

text_structure_and_purpose.title: Text Structure and Purpose
text_structure_and_purpose.description: Analyzing how texts are organized and understanding author's purpose and rhetorical strategies

cross_text_connections.title: Cross-Text Connections
cross_text_connections.description: Making connections between related texts and synthesizing information across sources

expression_of_ideas.title: Expression of Ideas
expression_of_ideas.description: Measures ability to revise texts to improve effectiveness and meet rhetorical goals

rhetorical_synthesis.title: Rhetorical Synthesis
rhetorical_synthesis.description: Combining information from multiple sources to create coherent, effective written expression
learning_objectives: Adapt writing for specific audiences and purposes

transitions.title: Transitions
transitions.description: Using appropriate transitional words and phrases to connect ideas and improve flow

standard_english_conventions.title: Standard English Conventions
standard_english_conventions.description: Measures ability to edit text to conform to Standard English sentence structure, usage, and punctuation

boundaries.title: Boundaries (Punctuation)
boundaries.description: Using punctuation correctly to clarify meaning and structure
learning_objectives: Use commas, semicolons, and colons correctly

form_structure_and_sense.title: Form, Structure, and Sense
form_structure_and_sense.description: Ensuring grammatical correctness and logical sentence construction
learning_objectives: Use correct verb tenses and forms

instructional_design_principles.clarity: Use clear, concise language appropriate for high school students
instructional_design_principles.scaffolding: Build from simple to complex concepts
instructional_design_principles.active_learning: Include interactive elements and practice opportunities
instructional_design_principles.real_world_relevance: Connect concepts to authentic SAT questions and scenarios
